intro: Tetratheca ciliata var. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long pedunculate tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its floral structure includes four petals and is adapted to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is distinguished by its elongated peduncles, which support its clusters of flowers.
